results.headline: A Wedding? Uncork the Rancor

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A.C.O.D.

results.summary_short: In “A.C.O.D.,” the hero tries to prevent his fractious divorced parents from spoiling his brother’s wedding.

results.headline: Dropping In on Tragedy, as if You Were There

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Let the Fire Burn

results.summary_short: “Let the Fire Burn” compiles found video to offer a riveting chronicle of the radical group Move and the Philadelphia police’s catastrophic siege of its headquarters in 1985.

results.headline: Life Is Long, but Then So Are the Country Roads of Argentina

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Dead Man and Being Happy

results.summary_short: In an Argentine road movie by Javier Rebollo, a former hit man and a new companion are going nowhere slowly.

results.headline: Both Sides of a Crime, Each Imperfect

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of On the Job

results.summary_short: The crime thriller “On the Job,” set in Manila, puts an assassin and a federal agent on a collision course.

results.headline: Close-Up Grief After a Parent’s Worst Nightmare

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Morning

results.summary_short: “Morning” is a portrait of a upper-middle-class couple in California mourning the sudden death of their beautiful only child.

results.headline: Free-Range Herds, in the Broadest Sense

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Winter Nomads

results.summary_short: A shepherd and his young apprentice spend a winter outdoors escorting 800 sheep on a traditional season of free grazing in “Winter Nomads.”

results.headline: It’s More Than What’s for Dinner

results.summary_short: The director Jim Mickle takes on Jorge Michel Grau’s 2011 creep-out, “We Are What We Are.”

results.headline: Survivor Stories

results.summary_short: The documentary “The Time Is ... Now” focuses on people who have survived catastrophes and violence.

results.headline: From Korea With Love

results.summary_short: In “The Spy: Undercover Operation,” a Korean comedy, the agent’s wife may be his most formidable challenge.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wedding Palace

results.summary_short: Wedding Palace,” directed by Christine Yoo, contrasts South Koreans in Seoul with supertraditional Korean-Americans.

results.headline: The Traditional (and Inner) Rhythms of Kabul

results.summary_short: Ariana Delawari mined her Afghan heritage for an album in 2009 and now a film, “We Came Home.”

results.summary_short: A nerd who lusts after the hottest girl in high school is reluctantly paired with another social outcast in “The Secret Lives of Dorks.”

results.headline: Fighting for a Cat’s Right to Scratch

results.summary_short: Jennifer Conrad, a California veterinarian, tackles the touchy subject of declawing cats in her documentary, “The Paw Project.”

results.summary_short: Afghanistan’s first independent TV operation is the subject of the documentary “The Network.”

results.headline: Alienated, From His First Day in the U.S.A.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Citizen

results.summary_short: “The Citizen” is about a Lebanese immigrant to the United States who arrives on Sept. 10, 2001, only to find his American dream quickly turn into a series of nightmares.

results.summary_short: In “Inequality for All,” Robert Reich, labor secretary under President Bill Clinton, explains America’s economic woes.

results.summary_short: The documentary “Muscle Shoals” looks at a studio where musicians including Aretha Franklin, Percy Sledge and the Rolling Stones recorded hit songs.

results.summary_short: “Metallica Through the Never,” a 3-D concert film, shows the rockers in robust middle-age form.

results.summary_short: Joseph Gordon-Levitt portrays a man hooked on pornography in “Don Jon,” which he also wrote and directed.

results.summary_short: A Palestinian student from the West Bank falls for an Israeli lawyer he meets in Tel Aviv in “Out in the Dark.”
